flawed_nl_solution:
The truck driver drives for 10 hours at 30 miles per hour, so she drives 10*30=<<10*30=300>>300 miles.
Therefore, she needs 300/10=<<300/10=30>>30 gallons of gas.
This will cost her 30*$2=$<<30*2=60>>60.
She will make 300*$0.5= $<<300*0.5=150>>150.
Thus, after paying for gas, she will make $150-$60=$<<150-60=92>>92.
#### 92

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 90, not 92. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
